title: Phase 2a: Port all 12 enums to TypeScript
body:
## Overview

Port all 12 PHP string enums from `php/src/v1/Enum/` to TypeScript in `ts/src/enum/`. These are simple string enums with schema.org URL values — no dependencies on other types.

## Reference

- **PHP source**: `php/src/v1/Enum/*.php` (12 files)
- **TS conventions**: `AGENTS-ts.md` → Enum Conventions section
- **TS skill**: `.claude/skills/ts-schema-implementation/SKILL.md` → Step 5
- **Existing TS scaffold**: `ts/src/schema/Brand.ts` (for style reference)

## Enums to implement

Create one file per enum in `ts/src/enum/`:

### 1. `DayOfWeek.ts` (7 cases)
```
Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, Friday, Saturday, Sunday
```
All values: `https://schema.org/{CaseName}`

### 2. `EventStatusType.ts` (4 cases)
```
EventScheduled, EventCancelled, EventPostponed, EventRescheduled
```

### 3. `EventAttendanceModeEnumeration.ts` (3 cases)
```
OfflineEventAttendanceMode, OnlineEventAttendanceMode, MixedEventAttendanceMode
```

### 4. `ItemAvailability.ts` (3 cases)
```
InStock, OutOfStock, Discontinued
```

### 5. `OfferItemCondition.ts` (4 cases)
```
NewCondition, RefurbishedCondition, UsedCondition, DamagedCondition
```

### 6. `MerchantReturnEnumeration.ts` (3 cases)
```
MerchantReturnFiniteReturnWindow, MerchantReturnNotPermitted, MerchantReturnUnlimitedWindow
```

### 7. `ReturnFeesEnumeration.ts` (3 cases)
```
FreeReturn, ReturnFeesCustomerResponsibility, ReturnShippingFees
```

### 8. `ReturnMethodEnumeration.ts` (3 cases)
```
ReturnAtKiosk, ReturnByMail, ReturnInStore
```

### 9. `ReturnLabelSourceEnumeration.ts` (3 cases)
```
ReturnLabelCustomerResponsibility, ReturnLabelDownloadAndPrint, ReturnLabelInBox
```

### 10. `RefundTypeEnumeration.ts` (3 cases)
```
ExchangeRefund, FullRefund, StoreCreditRefund
```

### 11. `TierBenefitEnumeration.ts` (2 cases)
```
TierBenefitLoyaltyPoints, TierBenefitLoyaltyPrice
```

### 12. `FulfillmentTypeEnumeration.ts` (2 cases)
```
FulfillmentTypeDelivery, FulfillmentTypeCollectionPoint
```

## Pattern

Every enum follows the same pattern. Example:

```typescript
export enum ItemAvailability {
	InStock = 'https://schema.org/InStock',
	OutOfStock = 'https://schema.org/OutOfStock',
	Discontinued = 'https://schema.org/Discontinued',
}
```

All values use the full schema.org URL: `https://schema.org/{CaseName}`.

## Tests

Create `ts/test/enum/enums.test.ts` — a single test file covering all 12 enums:

1. Each enum's values match the expected schema.org URLs
2. Each enum serializes correctly through JsonLdGenerator (create a minimal TypedSchema with an enum property to test)
3. All 40 total enum cases are covered

Use TDD: write failing tests first, then implement.

## Barrel exports

Update `ts/src/index.ts` to export all 12 enums. Keep exports sorted alphabetically.

## Acceptance criteria

- [ ] All 12 enum files created in `ts/src/enum/`
- [ ] All enum values match PHP exactly (verify against `php/src/v1/Enum/`)
- [ ] Tests pass (`npm run test`)
- [ ] Biome passes (`npx biome check`)
- [ ] Build succeeds (`npm run build`)
- [ ] `index.ts` updated with all enum exports
- [ ] No modifications to `JsonLdGenerator.ts` or `TypedSchema.ts`
